prod_desc.heading: Why Buy JBL Wave Beam TWS Earbuds
features: Bluetooth v5.2 provides high efficiency and high-speed connection
8mm Dynamic driver for deeper bass, crisp clear, and seamless sound
Premium and stylish looks make it more attractive and very impressive
With microphone great for making phone calls for several reasons
sub_features: Do you want to hear great sound with great sound quality? Get the JBL Wave Beam TWS Earbuds. Get the most out of your mix with high-quality audio from safe, reliable earbuds. Powered by the 8mm drivers with JBL deep bass sound. The JBL Wave Beam's ergonomic closed-back design fits so comfortably you'll forget you're wearing it. The closed design keeps out external noise and improves bass performance. With 8 hours of battery life in the earbuds and 24 hours in the case, the JBL Wave Beam gives you audio all day long. And when you need more power, you can charge JBL Wave Beam TWS Earbuds in just 10 minutes for 2 hours of playtime.

The JBL Wave Beam TWS Earbuds have smart ambient technology that allows you to hear everything, wherever you are. When you need to pause for a quick conversation, TalkThru allows you to instantly hear yourself and those around you without taking out your earphones. Or keep your music alive with Ambient Aware If you're on the go with hands-free stereo calling, VoiceAware can help you find the balance. From the beach to the bike path, the IP54-rated earbuds and IPX2 charging case are water and dust resistant for all-day use. So, grab these JBL Wave Beam TWS Earbuds, online!

faqs.que: Is it worth getting wireless earbuds?
faqs.ans: Yes, they are worthwhile, mainly if you are interested in fitness or travel. Wireless earphones have become much more affordable in recent years. The absence of wires allows for a more excellent range of motion and connectivity with a wide range of devices.

faqs.que: What is the lifespan of wireless earbuds?
faqs.ans: You should get roughly two years out of cheap or average-quality earbuds. Best wireless earbuds can endure for four or five years if appropriately purchased. Furthermore, earbuds have a 2 - 4 year average lifespan.

faqs.que: Which is better, earbuds or AirPods?
faqs.ans: The most noticeable difference between traditional EarPods and the new AirPods would be that the AirPods are entirely wireless, while the EarPods are not. For those who had problems keeping the connected EarPods on their ears, the new AirPods are the solution.

faqs.que: Can wireless earbuds be used individually?
faqs.ans: True wireless earphones still use Bluetooth technology, but instead of being incorporated into a wire, the Bluetooth connection is built directly into each earpiece. Because the earbuds are distinct, you may use each separately or join them together for a more immersive music experience.
